item.title: Fate/EXTRA Record delayed to spring 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Japanese game editions detailed.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer TYPE-MOON studio BB have delayed Fate/EXTRA full remake Fate/EXTRA Record from its previously announced 2025 release window to spring 2026 for further quality improvements. It will be available for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam.

In Japan, physical editions of Fate/EXTRA Record will be available for PlayStation 5 and Switch. The standard edition will cost 8,100 yen, while the following limited editions will also be available:

  • Limited Edition (15,00 yen)
    • A copy of the game
    • Special multi-steel case and three-disc soundtrack CD “Fate/EXTRA Record Soundtracks”
    • Special art book “Fate/EXTRA Record Material”
  • ASOBI STORE Special Edition (25,300 yen)
    • Limited edition content
    • Special LP disc “Fate/EXTRA Record Soundtrack Selection”
    • Multilayer acrylic block
  • ASOBI STORE Ultra Special Edition (35,800 yen)
    • ASOBI Store Special Edition content
    • Illustrated character fine graph with serial number
  • Digital Deluxe Edition (12,000 yen)
    • A copy of the game
    • “My Servant & Protagonist Special Costume Pack”
    • “Fate/EXTRA Original Background Music Pack”
    • Digital soundtrack and art book

A Digital Deluxe Edition Upgrade will also be available for 4,500 yen, which includes the Digital Deluxe Edition’s bonus content.

Additionally, first-print copies of the physical edition and pre-orders of the digital edition will include a redemption code for the “Tsukimihara Academy Uniform My Servant Costume Set.”
